news.headline: TCS Reports Q4 FY25 Results: Revenue Grows, Profit Declines
news.text: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) reported a 5.3% year-on-year increase in revenue to ₹64,479 crore for Q4 FY25. However, net profit declined by 1.6% to ₹12,224 crore. The company achieved a total contract value of $12.2 billion for the quarter, contributing to a full-year TCV of $39.4 billion. Despite the revenue growth, TCS missed analysts' estimates due to continued weakness in its key North American market.

news.headline: TCS Cuts Variable Pay for Senior Employees for Third Consecutive Quarter
news.text: TCS has reduced variable pay for senior employees for the third straight quarter, citing global economic uncertainties and an attendance-linked policy introduced in April 2024. Some senior staff received as low as 20% of their eligible variable pay. Additionally, the company has delayed annual salary hikes, which were expected in April 2025.

news.headline: TCS Partners with Google Cloud to Enhance AI-led Transformation
news.text: TCS announced a partnership with Google Cloud to accelerate AI-led transformation in the retail sector. This collaboration aims to leverage Google's AI capabilities and TCS's industry expertise to deliver innovative solutions for retail businesses.

news.headline: TCS Launches Next-Gen Capabilities to Support India's Deep-Tech Ambitions
news.text: TCS has launched next-generation capabilities to support India's aspirations in deep-tech. This initiative focuses on advancing technologies such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and quantum computing to drive innovation and economic growth in the country.
